required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of the SurroundScope in Urologic Surgical Procedures
clinical_study.official_title: Assessment of the SurroundScope in Urologic Surgical Procedures

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to evaluate standard urological surgeries using the 270Surgical system vs same procedures using the standard scope

detailed_description.textblock: The tremendous popularity of the laparoscopic surgeries is balanced with its tradeoffs - the needs for an excellent intracavitary visualization along with a surgeon skill set capable of performing these, often more technically challenging procedures. Image quality has improved, but there are still various restrictions to images captured by the lens at the tip of a long tubular laparoscope. 270Surgical developed a 270 degree angle scope to overcome these unmet needs and improve the image quantity and extent during laparoscopy. The study will compare the use of the 270Surgical system (The "SurroundScope") to standard laparoscope during partial nephrectomy and nephrectomy urilogical surgeries;

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: For laparoscopic camera system to be used in urological surgeries, the SurroundScope, 270-degree angle videoscope (270Surgical, Israel) is used. This will be compared to the standard laparoscopic system use. The study will evaluate standard urological surgeries using the 270Surgical system vs same procedures using the standard scope. The procedure will be performed according to the institution's standard of care, using the SurroundScope or the standard scope for visualization. Each surgery will be captured on video.
study_design_info.masking_description: Patients are not aware of the laparoscopic system that will be used during the operation.

primary_outcome.measure: Analysis of the efficient work time with the standard scope and the SurroundScope - Time of surgery
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the surgery - Since the first incision performed till the last incision is closed
primary_outcome.description: Data collected include - skin to skin time of surgery

primary_outcome.measure: Analysis of the efficient work time with the standard scope and the SurroundScope - tools and ports Visibility time
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the surgery - Since the first incision performed till the last incision is closed
primary_outcome.description: Data collected include - Visibility time of tools and ports in the Field of view

primary_outcome.measure: Analysis of the efficient work time with the standard scope and the SurroundScope - time of scope removals
primary_outcome.time_frame: During the surgery - Since the first incision performed till the last incision is closed
primary_outcome.description: Data collected include - Time of scope removals during the case to clear smoke or fog

secondary_outcome.measure: Time of defined surgical tasks - port placement time
secondary_outcome.description: Time to complete port placement will be measured

secondary_outcome.measure: Time of defined surgical tasks - transection time
secondary_outcome.description: Time to transection of renal artery & Vein with stapler will be measured

secondary_outcome.measure: Time of defined surgical tasks - clamp time
secondary_outcome.description: Clamp time during partial nephrectomy will be measured

other_outcome.time_frame: During the surgery - Since the first incision performed till the last incision is closed
Since the surgery comletion to discharg from the medical center
other_outcome.description: Length of stay at the hospital following the surgery in days

other_outcome.time_frame: Immidiately following the surgery is completed
other_outcome.description: Surgeon's perception of the 270System - Assessed by a multi-question subjective questionnaire completed in the OR,immediately after the case, by the surgeon and the camera person and constructedon a Likert-type, 5-point scale (1=Strongly disagree, 2=Disagree, 3=Neither agreeor disagree, 4=Agree, 5=Strongly agree).

arm_group.description: For laparoscopic camera system, the SurroundScope, 270-degree angle videoscope (270Surgical, Israel) is used
For laparoscopic camera system, the Standard laparoscope that is in a standard use at the medical center is used

intervention.description: The procedure will be performed according to the institution's standard of care, using the SurroundScope for visualization.
The procedure will be performed according to the institution's standard of care, using the Standard laparoscope for visualization.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age greater than or equal to 18
- Capable of giving informed consent.
- Scheduled for laparoscopic urologic surgery: Partial nephrectomy, Nephrectomy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unfit for surgery: concomitant disorders incompatible with the study or surgery (at the discretion of the investigator)
- Patients with contraindications to undergo laparoscopic surgery.
- Patients with ASA class* >3
- Advanced cirrhosis with failure of hepatic function
- Patients who have participated in another interventional clinical study in the last month.
- Pregnancy
- Unable to consent (due to cultural, language or neurological barriers)
